name: Doctor Appointment
input: My stomach has been hurting for two days. I need to see Dr. Smith on Thursday morning.

script.opening: Hi, I'm calling on behalf of Alex. They've been having stomach pain for two days and would really appreciate an appointment. There's no rush ‚Äî whenever you have a moment is perfect.
script.confirm_line: Just to make sure I have that right ‚Äî Thursday at 9am for Alex, for stomach pain. Does that sound correct?
script.closing: Thank you so much. Alex really appreciates your help. Have a lovely day.

transcript: Thank you for calling Dr. Smith's office, how can I help you today?
Hi, I'm calling on behalf of Alex. They've been having stomach pain for two days and would really appreciate an appointment. There's no rush ‚Äî whenever you have a moment is perfect.
Of course, let me take a look at our availability. We have Thursday at 9am or Friday at 11am.
Thursday at 9am would be wonderful. Just to make sure I have that right ‚Äî Thursday at 9am for Alex, for stomach pain. Does that sound correct?
Yes that's correct, I've got Alex booked in for Thursday the 14th at 9am.
Perfect. And just to confirm one more time ‚Äî that's Thursday the 14th at 9am with Dr. Smith for Alex?
Yes, confirmed. Is there anything else I can help with?
No, that's everything. Thank you so much for your help. Alex really appreciates it. Have a lovely day.
calm.summary: Great news, Alex. Your appointment with Dr. Sarah Smith is confirmed for Thursday at 9am. The receptionist was very helpful. You don't need to do anything ‚Äî just show up on Thursday morning.

script.opening: Hi, calling for Alex. Need to book an appointment for stomach pain, Thursday morning if possible.
script.confirm_line: Thursday 9am for Alex ‚Äî stomach pain. Got it?

transcript: Thank you for calling Dr. Smith's office.
Hi, calling for Alex. Need to book for stomach pain, Thursday morning.
We have Thursday at 9am available.
Perfect, Thursday 9am for Alex ‚Äî stomach pain. Confirmed?
Confirmed. Anything else?
No thanks. Bye.
power.summary: Done. Appointment booked ‚Äî Dr. Smith, Thursday 9am, stomach pain.

name: Bank Dispute
input: There's a charge on my Chase account I don't recognize ‚Äî $47.99 from last Tuesday. I need to dispute it.

expected_intent.reason: unrecognized charge of $47.99 from last Tuesday

script.opening: Hi, I'm calling on behalf of Alex. There's a charge on their account they don't recognize and it's been worrying them a little. It's $47.99 from last Tuesday. Could you help look into it when you get a chance?
script.confirm_line: Just so Alex knows ‚Äî a dispute has been opened for the $47.99 charge from Tuesday. They'll get a confirmation email. Is that right?
script.closing: Thank you so much. Alex really appreciates your patience and help today.

transcript: Thank you for calling Chase Bank, how can I assist you today?
Hi, I'm calling on behalf of Alex. There's a charge they don't recognize and it's been worrying them. It's $47.99 from last Tuesday. Could you help look into it?
Of course, I'd be happy to help. Can you confirm the account holder's name and last four digits of the card?
The account holder is Alex. I don't have the card digits but the charge is $47.99 from Tuesday the 8th.
I've located the charge. I'll open a dispute case for you right now.
Just so Alex knows ‚Äî a dispute has been opened for the $47.99 charge from Tuesday. They'll get a confirmation email. Is that right?
That's correct. Case number DIS-889234. Email confirmation within 24 hours.
And just to confirm the case number ‚Äî DIS-889234?
Yes, that's right.
Wonderful. Thank you so much for your patience and help today. Alex really appreciates it.
calm.summary: All sorted, Alex. The $47.99 charge has been disputed ‚Äî case number DIS-889234. Chase will email you a confirmation within 24 hours. You don't need to do anything else.

script.opening: Calling for Alex. Disputing a $47.99 charge from last Tuesday, unrecognized.
script.confirm_line: Dispute opened, case number noted. Email confirmation incoming?

transcript: Thank you for calling Chase Bank.
Calling for Alex. Disputing $47.99 from Tuesday ‚Äî unrecognized charge.
I'll open a dispute now. Case number DIS-889234. Confirmation email within 24 hours.
Dispute opened, case DIS-889234, email incoming. Confirmed?
Confirmed.
Thanks.
power.summary: Dispute filed. Case DIS-889234. Confirmation email in 24 hours.

name: Pharmacy Refill
input: I need to refill my prescription at CVS. It's metformin, prescription number RX7823456.

script.opening: Hi, I'm calling to refill a prescription for Alex. The prescription number is RX7823456, it's for metformin. Whenever it's ready is completely fine ‚Äî no rush at all.
script.confirm_line: So to make sure I have that right ‚Äî metformin, RX7823456, for Alex, ready tomorrow after 2pm?
script.closing: Thank you so much. Alex will come by tomorrow afternoon. Have a good day.

transcript: Thank you for calling CVS Pharmacy.
Hi, I'm calling to refill a prescription for Alex. Prescription number RX7823456, metformin. Whenever it's ready is fine ‚Äî no rush.
I can process that refill now. Let me pull up that prescription.
Found it ‚Äî metformin 500mg for Alex. I'll process the refill now.
So to make sure I have that right ‚Äî metformin, RX7823456, for Alex, ready tomorrow after 2pm?
That's correct, ready for pickup tomorrow after 2pm.
And just to double-check ‚Äî tomorrow after 2pm at the CVS on Main Street?
Yes, that's right.
Perfect. Thank you so much. Alex will come by tomorrow afternoon. Have a good day.
calm.summary: Your metformin refill is all set, Alex. It'll be ready to pick up at CVS tomorrow after 2pm. No rush ‚Äî just go whenever you're comfortable.

transcript: CVS Pharmacy, how can I help?
Refill for Alex. RX7823456, metformin.
Processing. Ready tomorrow after 2pm.
Confirmed. Thanks.

name: Insurance Query
input: I need to check if my Blue Cross plan covers physiotherapy and how many sessions I get.

script.opening: Hi, I'm calling on behalf of Alex. They'd like to understand their physiotherapy coverage ‚Äî specifically whether it's covered and how many sessions are included. Insurance can be confusing so any help explaining it clearly would mean a lot.
script.confirm_line: Just so Alex is clear ‚Äî physiotherapy is covered, with 20 sessions per year, and a $30 copay each time. Is that right?
script.closing: Thank you so much for explaining everything clearly. Alex really appreciates your patience.

transcript: Thank you for calling Blue Cross Blue Shield member services.
Hi, calling on behalf of Alex. They'd like to understand their physiotherapy coverage. Insurance can be confusing, so any clear explanation would mean a lot.
Of course, I'm happy to help. Can I get Alex's member ID or date of birth to pull up the account?
I don't have the member ID handy, but the name is Alex and the plan is through Blue Cross.
I can look that up. One moment... I've found the account. Alex has physiotherapy coverage ‚Äî 20 sessions per year with a $30 copay per visit.
Just so Alex is clear ‚Äî physiotherapy is covered, 20 sessions per year, $30 copay each time. Is that right?
That's correct. Sessions reset every January 1st.
And just to confirm ‚Äî 20 sessions, $30 copay, resets January 1st?
Yes, that's all correct.
Perfect. Thank you so much for explaining everything so clearly. Alex really appreciates your patience.
calm.summary: Good news, Alex. Physiotherapy is covered under your Blue Cross plan ‚Äî you get 20 sessions per year with a $30 copay each visit. Sessions reset on January 1st each year. You're all set.

script.opening: Calling for Alex. Checking physiotherapy coverage on their Blue Cross plan.

transcript: Blue Cross member services.
Checking physiotherapy coverage for Alex on Blue Cross.
20 sessions per year, $30 copay. Resets January 1st.
20 sessions, $30 copay, resets January. Confirmed?
Confirmed.
Thanks.
power.summary: Physio covered. 20 sessions/year, $30 copay. Resets Jan 1.

name: Utility / Gov Service
input: My electricity bill has a weird extra charge of $23 this month. Can you call PG&E and find out what it is?

script.opening: Hi, I'm calling on behalf of Alex. There's an extra $23 charge on their electricity bill this month that they don't quite understand. Could you help explain what it might be? Alex just wants to understand, not cause any trouble.
script.confirm_line: So the $23 is a grid maintenance fee, it appears every 3 months, and it's normal and expected. Is that right?
script.closing: Thank you so much for explaining that. Alex feels much better knowing what it is. Have a good day.

transcript: Thank you for calling PG&E customer service.
Hi, calling on behalf of Alex. There's an extra $23 on their bill this month they don't understand. They just want to know what it is ‚Äî not causing trouble, just a bit confused.
Of course, let me pull up the account. Can I get the account number or service address?
The account holder is Alex. I don't have the number handy.
I can look by name and address. One moment... Found it. That $23 charge is a quarterly grid maintenance fee. It appears every three months and is a standard utility charge.
So the $23 is a grid maintenance fee, it appears every 3 months, and it's normal and expected. Is that right?
That's exactly right. Completely standard.
And just to be sure ‚Äî it's not a mistake, it'll appear again in 3 months, and there's nothing to worry about?
Correct on all three.
Perfect. Thank you so much for explaining that so clearly. Alex feels much better knowing what it is. Have a good day.
calm.summary: Nothing to worry about, Alex. That $23 is a regular quarterly grid maintenance fee ‚Äî completely normal. It will show up every 3 months. Everything is fine with your account.

script.opening: Calling for Alex. Querying a $23 extra charge on this month's PG&E bill.
script.confirm_line: Quarterly grid fee, normal, appears every 3 months. Confirmed?

transcript: PG&E customer service.
Querying $23 extra charge on Alex's bill this month.
That's a quarterly grid maintenance fee. Standard charge every 3 months.
Quarterly grid fee, normal, every 3 months. Confirmed?
Confirmed.
Thanks.
power.summary: $23 = quarterly grid maintenance fee. Normal. Every 3 months.
